title: How To Stay Organized And Sane As A Busy Mom
summary: A list of checklists for your daily routine is a great way to stay organized as a busy mom. Cleaning as you go will ensure that messes donâ€™t become overwhelming and cause you to avoid cleaning altogether. Set a timer to help you stay on top of multiple tasks. Find a cleaning buddy or two can help keep you motivated to get things done. Schedule in time for self-care for yourself and carve out some time each week to do something that makes you feel relaxed and happy.

If you\u2019re feeling disorganized, a checklist can help you get back on track. It\u2019s easy to get caught up in the daily busyness and stress of being a mom, and if you don\u2019t take care of yourself, you won\u2019t be able to take care of others."),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Schedule in time for self-care.")),mdx("h2",null,"Finding a \u201Cshoulder\u201D friend"),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re struggling to find time for self-care, or you\u2019re feeling overwhelmed and just don\u2019t know what to do next, find a friend who\u2019s willing to support you and help you get through whatever is going on in your life. This \u201Cshoulder\u201D friend could be a family member, another mom, your partner, a close friend, etc."),mdx("p",null,"The key to successfully using this strategy is to choose someone who is willing to listen without judging you, criticizing you, or trying to \u201Cfix\u201D your problems. Someone who is willing to simply listen, ask questions if they don\u2019t understand what you\u2019re going through, and empathize with you."),mdx("h2",null,"Make a chore wheel"),mdx("p",null,"A chore wheel is a great way to keep track of chores and avoid arguments about who does what. Simply create a chore wheel with the different chores for your home, and assign each person one or two chores. This can work for kids and adults. There are also chore wheels you can use online, or you can create your own using a dry erase board or poster board."),mdx("p",null,"Keep in mind that this is just a visual way of keeping track of chores, not a way of assigning them. You can\u2019t assign a chore to someone because they \u201Cowe\u201D you. You could also assign each person a \u201Cprivilege\u201D or \u201Cperk\u201D that they get to pick, like getting the first use of the car on a certain day, having a special dessert once a week, etc."),mdx("h2",null,"Make cleaning a habit"),mdx("p",null,"Making cleaning a habit is a great way to stay organized and not have to stress about keeping a clean house all the time. Choose one cleaning task each week and make it into a regular habit. For example, every Sunday do some sort of cleaning task like sweeping and mopping floors, washing dishes, etc. Once you make it a habit, it will be something you don\u2019t even have to think about. You can also set aside a certain day of the week for certain cleaning tasks. For example, have cleaning day on Saturday, or make Friday \u201Cbathroom cleaning day\u201D. This can help keep you from feeling totally overwhelmed."),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Make cleaning a habit: Make cleaning a habit."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Declutter regularly: Clutter can make it harder to keep your house clean and organized. Simply decluttering regularly can make a big difference."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Keep lists: Keep lists of everything in your home. This makes it easier to keep on top of things, and it\u2019s a good reminder of what needs to be done."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Clean as you go: Cleaning as you go is a great way to keep a clean house.")),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t be afraid to ask for help"),mdx("p",null,"Being a busy mom can sometimes feel like you need to be superwoman. If you\u2019re feeling overwhelmed and are feeling like you can\u2019t keep up with everything, don\u2019t be afraid to ask for help."),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Ask for help from your partner."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Ask for help from friends or family."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Ask for help from a service like Helpling if you need a one-off cleaning done."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Ask for help from a neighborhood kid: Sometimes just having someone to talk to and help around the house can make a huge difference in your mood and ability to handle things.")),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"Being a busy mom can be challenging, but being organized can help you to stay on top of things."),mdx("p",null,"There are many different ways to stay on top of things as a busy mom, but the most important thing is to be realistic and consistent. relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Wait
The Top 10 Funniest Cat Videos on Youtube

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Why do crazy cat people love their cats so much? Because their cats are hilarious. With their constant sneering and condescending glares, feline friends have a knack for being entertaining in the most ridiculous ways. So, if you need a break from those stressful final exam cram sessions, we've compiled a list of the top 10 funniest cat videos on YouTube. From silly cats to crafty cats and everything in between, these videos will give you some much-needed LOLs.
Cat videos are one of the most popular video niches online today. There are several channels on YouTube that are dedicated only to cat videos and nothing else. In this post we\u2019ll look at some of the best channels that feature nothing but cat content \u2013 be it funny cat vines or cute cat compilations \u2013 as well as some of our favorite individual clips from these creators.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a win-win proposition for businesses. It\u2019s an impartial and confidential process that helps individuals, businesses, and organizations reach mutually beneficial solutions to their conflicts. These solutions are usually in the form of agreements called \u201Cmediation agreements\u201D or \u201Ccollaborative mediation agreements.\u201D Mediation is not a one-time event but rather an ongoing process and collaboration between the disputants that involves multiple sessions.
Mediation can be used in all kinds of relationships where there is an opportunity to explore different ways of dealing with conflict and find win-win solutions without having to go to court or some other expensive third party adjudication. These include disputes between partners, shareholders, suppliers, customers, tenants, employees, suppliers and competitors; labor/management; landlord/tenant; divorcing spouses; members of nonprofit boards; roommates; feuding neighbours; business partners (and service providers); vendors (and clients); owners and real estate developers; executors and beneficiaries of trusts; owners and local governments etc.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Drawbacks of Mediation?

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a great option for resolving disputes and reducing the stress of a legal conflict. It\u2019t also less expensive than going to court and doesn\u2019t give your opponent any negative information that could be used against you in the future. The only potential drawback to mediation is that it requires both parties to agree on an outcome they are happy with. If one party feels like they have no other options, they may not be willing to mediate. However, this should not stop you from exploring this option further.
Mediation has many benefits over other methods of dispute resolution, such as negotiation and arbitration. However, every type of settlement has its drawbacks. Read on to learn more about the pros and cons of mediation as a dispute resolution technique:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get over a Break-Up

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In the unfortunate event that you find yourself in a situation where you need to get over a break-up, it\u2019s important to know what to do in order to help the healing process along. Break-ups are never easy, and they can be even more difficult and hurtful if it\u2019s with your first love or someone you really cared about. These tips will help get you through any heartbreak and back into a place of peace.
When you experience a break-up, whether it\u2019s from a partner, friend or family member, it leaves you with an empty feeling. It hurts so much because you placed so many emotions into the relationship that it now feels like a part of who you are has been taken from you. Even though the person who broke up with you may have been oblivious to the pain they were causing by ending things, that doesn\u2019t make breaking up any easier for anyone involved.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Mediation is a process that helps people resolve conflicts and find solutions to difficult problems. It\u2019t not the same thing as arbitration or negotiation. Mediation is a voluntary process in which a neutral third party, the mediator, assists others in exploring issues, managing conflict, and solving problems in an effort to resolve conflict and move forward. The parties involved in the dispute remain control over their own destiny at all times. They are free to walk away from mediation at any time with no consequence. The goal of mediation is not compromise but resolution. It\u2019t win-win or lose-lose but instead find a place somewhere between those two extremes where both parties can feel satisfied with the outcome of their dispute.  Mediation services are often provided by private organizations such as nonprofit community mediation centers or faith-based centers that offer these services pro bono publico, which means \u201Cfor the good of the public\u201D without charge."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Reduce Stress during the Holiday Season
How to Get through a Break-Up

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Everyone knows break-ups are tough. Even if you know the relationship is ending, the final moments can still be filled with pain and heartbreak. However, a breakup doesn\u2019t need to be final in every sense of the word. In time, you will recover from your failed relationship and move on with your life. Here are some effective ways to make this happen sooner rather than later.
If you\u2019ve recently broken up with your partner or dating partner, it can feel like the end of the world. But it\u2019s not! A relationship coming to an end does not mean there is something wrong with you or that you aren\u2019t good enough for anyone or that you will never find love again. Your heart is broken at this moment because you cared deeply about this person - now you just have to understand why and how things went south so that it doesn\u2019t happen again in your future relationships`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
